Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • Character

  • public class Character
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage knight
      Initializes BufferedImage knightSheet (a spritesheet) and knight (the character image itself).
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage knightSheet
      Initializes BufferedImage knightSheet (a spritesheet) and knight (the character image itself).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Character()
      The constructor class loads the spritesheet and loops through it to put each image in the 2D array knightArray.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void animateCharacter(int rows, int startCol, int endCol)
      animateCharacter loops through the 2D array knightSheet to frame-by-frame animation.
      void drawCharacter(java.awt.Graphics g)
      drawCharacter draws the character sprite at the specified location and size.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • knightSheet

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage knightSheet
        Initializes BufferedImage knightSheet (a spritesheet) and knight (the character image itself). The ints are used in the for-loop knightArray holds the images in the spritesheet so they can be easily called later.

      • knight

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage knight
        Initializes BufferedImage knightSheet (a spritesheet) and knight (the character image itself). The ints are used in the for-loop knightArray holds the images in the spritesheet so they can be easily called later.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Character

        public Character()
        The constructor class loads the spritesheet and loops through it to put each image in the 2D array knightArray. The constructor also sets the default sprite position that loads when the game starts.

    • Method Detail

      • drawCharacter

        public void drawCharacter(java.awt.Graphics g)
        drawCharacter draws the character sprite at the specified location and size.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics object used to draw images.

      • animateCharacter

        public void animateCharacter(int rows,
                             int startCol,
                             int endCol)
        animateCharacter loops through the 2D array knightSheet to frame-by-frame animation.
        Parameters:
        rows - Row from which to get image (starts at 0).
        startCol - Column at which to start to get image (starts at 0).
        endCol - Column at which to end to get image (starts at 0).
